channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 19,499 with 684 new fatalities
item.description: It comes as more questions emerged over the true number of Britons dying in care homes today after figures from Northern Ireland showed a third of all fatalities were elderly residents.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Traffic returns to roads and queues form
item.description: Figures from the AA show show more car journeys than at any point over the past few weeks in a sign the economy is slowly restarting. Pictured: the A40 in west London this morning.

item.title: You had one job! South Africa's President Ramaphosa hilariously struggles to put coronavirus mask on
item.description: South Africa President Cyril Ramaphosa was captured struggling to get his facemask on after delivering a speech on the importance of wearing them, in a blunder livestreamed yesterday.

item.title: Sweden sees record number of coronavirus infections for second day in a row - 812
item.description: Sweden has reported a record number of new coronavirus cases for the second day in a row - 812 - just as the country threatens to close bars and restaurants that don't social distance.

item.title: Almost half of people have seen a rise in speeding during lockdown
item.description: Roads with 30mph limits that have been found to be most lethal, with Department for Transport data showing that 60% of all accidents and 34% of all traffic-related fatalities occur in these zones.

item.title: Gunman opens fire as hundreds of mourners pay respects to Manchester godfather 'Mr Ibiza'Â
item.description: A gunman opened fire at mourners broke social distancing rules to attend the funeral of a father dubbed 'Mr Ibiza' in a Manchester cemetery in Gorton before being stabbed.

item.title: Living in the future! Expat reveals the VERY clever features in her Japanese home
item.description: Travel vlogger Caitlin, who is originally from San Diego, offers her 1.5million TikTok fans a look inside her ultra-modern two-story house in Iwakuni, Japan, which is full of futuristic features.

item.title: Australia is steamrolling the curve: Nation records just 17 cases in one day
item.description: Just 17 new cases of COVID-19, the killer respiratory virus which was crippled dozens of other countries, were recorded in Australia in the 24 hours from midnight on Thursday.

item.title: Almost FOUR MILLION workers are now having their wages paid by the Government
item.description: Some 512,000 firms employing 3.8million people have applied to furlough them on the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme since Monday. Brewer Greene King furloughed 36,000 today.

item.title: Trump's aides launched extraordinary effort to push hydroxychloroquine as coronavirus treatment
item.description: Donald Trump's aides on the front lines of the coronavirus response launched a behind-the-scenes effort to push antimalarial drug hydroxychloroquine as a treatment for the virus.

item.title: Rich blogger, 24, swaps her stilettos for scrubs
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Sepii Samaee, 24, from North London, lives with her wealthy Iranian parents and stylish sisters Sol, 37, and Sayna, 33, told FEMAIL she's set to start working as a junior doctor.

item.title: Lynn Faulds Wood dead: Watchdog presenter dies aged 72 after 'stroke'
item.description: Lynn Faulds Wood passed away at midday with her husband John Stapleton and son, Nick, by her bedside after suffering a 'massive stroke' last night, confirmed the former Watchdog host's family.

item.title: NHS doctor who died of Covid-19 pleaded for PPE before his death
item.description: Dr Peter Tun died aged 62 at his own workplace, the Royal Berkshire Hospital, on April 13 after testing positive for the coronavirus a week earlier. He had written to managers seeking PPE supplies.

item.title: Most students whose exams have been cancelled due to coronavirus will be graded on previous work
item.description: Under plans announced by Ofqual on Friday, many students will receive a calculated result based on what staff in schools and colleges think they would have achieved in their assessments this summer.

item.title: Border Force intercepts five boats carrying about 60 migrants off Kent coast
item.description: Border Force officers are also understood to be intercepting a sixth vessel off the Kent coast this morning. It means April will be a record month for crossings as the total could already exceed 400.

item.title: Twitter mocks Donald Trump for suggesting Covid-19 can be treated by injecting disinfectant
item.description: Trump brought up possible treatments including 'injecting' cleaning agents in the body and use of ultraviolet lights at Thursday's White House press briefing.

item.title: Consultant who cares for babies and 'selfless' nurse are latest NHS workers to die from coronavirus
item.description: Dr Vishna Rasiah, a Birmingham consultant for newborn babies, and carer June Anderson from Anfield are among the latest NHS workers to have died of Coronavirus.

item.title: Kent zoo keeper may have to euthanise his animals so they don't starve as funds run out in lockdown
item.description: The owner of the Fenn Bell Conservation Project in St Mary Hoo, Kent, Andy Cowell, 51, is struggling to find enough money to pay his Â£2,000-a-day animal food bill during the lockdown.

item.title: Scientists reveal ferocious predators roamed Africa's SAHARA 100 million years ago
item.description: A team of international researchers found that what is today the Sahara region was home to 'ferocious predators' around 100 million years ago.
item.media:description: An artistÂ´s impression of the Sahara 100 million years ago (University of Portsmouth/PA)

item.title: Coronavirus dies in SUNLIGHT in just minutes, reveals 'striking' study
item.description: The study was carried out at the National Biodefense Analysis and Countermeasures Center in Maryland. It showed that UV rays had a potent impact on the pathogen.

item.title: Meghan Markle had no contact with her father for two years despite claiming he felt 'harassed'
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 38, is suing Associated Newspapers, owner of the Mail on Sunday and MailOnline, over an article which reproduced parts of a handwritten letter she sent to Mr Markle, 75.

item.title: Syd Little is among mourners at Eddie Large's funeral after star died from coronavirus
item.description: Around 50 well-wishers turned out to show their support for the comedian as his body was taken to a crematorium in Portishead, Somerset this afternoon.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Key workers start booking Covid-19 tests under new system
item.description: Ten million key workers and their households in Britain are now eligible for the coronavirus tests, but all applications shut at 10am today on the website and will not reopen until 8am tomorrow.

item.title: Tropical coral reefs are being transformed by climate change
item.description: Climate change and warming seas are severely bleaching tropical coral reefs and undoing decades of knowledge about how to protect these delicate and vital ecosystems.

item.title: Coronavirus: Government under fire over test and trace programme staffing levels
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock announced yesterday that some 18,000 staff will be put in place as part of the mass-testing scheme but scientists do not believe that will be enough.

item.title: Hubble Space Telescope releases a 'breathtaking' new image of a giant nebula
item.description: Named the 'tapestry of blazing starbirth', the new image brings together the nebula NGC 2014 and its neighbour NGC 2020 - both about 163,000 light years from Earth

item.title: Italy will ease lockdown over next four weeks, local media says
item.description: Building sites and the textile and fashion industries could re-open in Italy on May 4, followed by shops including clothes stores on May 11 and bars and restaurants on May 18.

item.title: Wi-Fi to get its biggest upgrade in 20 years after FCC's 6GHz decision
item.description: The US Federal Communications Commission has approved is opening up spectrum in the 6GHz band, ushering an era of fast, low latency internet connections.

item.title: Coronavirus: Scotland could soon allow small gatherings
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon today suggested people in Scotland could soon be allowed to meet a small 'bubble' of friends or family outside of their households under plans to ease the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: 18-year-old goes from weighing 18st aged 12 to 10st and is Slimming World's Young Slimmer 2020
item.description: Holly Bolton, 18, from Brentwood, was told by a dietitian when she was 12 and weighed 18st that she would only be able to lose weight through surgery; She now weigs 10st, and wears a size 8.

item.title: Distraught couples lose tens of thousands of pounds over weddings cancelled by coronavirus
item.description: Couple are charged thousands as weddings are cancelled due to coronavirus. Adam Gibbs, 36, and Sarah Summerskill, 33, from Woking, were charged an 80% cancellation fee.

item.title: Gangs of London leaves viewers gripped but insist violence is not for the faint hearted
item.description: New Sky Atlantic drama Gangs of London left viewers gripped with it's 'increible' fight scenes, but insisted the 'brutal' violence of the show left them wincing at the graphic scenes

item.title: Spain sees large SPIKE in number of new coronavirus cases
item.description: The thousands of positive tests bring the Spanish total from 213,024 to 219,764 in the biggest increase since 7,026 were recorded on April 4.

item.title: China shuts 18,576 social media accounts for 'spreading fake news' during coronavirus outbreak
item.description: Multiple accounts had promoted false information about the outbreak, causing negative social impact, the Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC) accused.

item.title: Sicily will PAY half the price of tourists' flights in bid to lure back holidaymakers after lockdown
item.description: A â¬50 million budget will pay for the scheme designed to rejuvenateÂ tourism. The vouchers will be made available on the island's tourism website.

item.title: Middlesbrough drug-dealing pimp jailed for 29 years after raping schoolgirls
item.description: Junior Chester Bryan (pictured), 63, from Middlesbrough, was convicted of 20 offences and admitted three more at Teesside Crown Court. He was given a 29-year extended sentence.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Donald Trump suggests bizarre treatments
item.description: Donald Trump raised new possible treatments at Thursday's White House press briefing that included 'injecting' cleaning agents into the body and exposing the body to light.

item.title: Plasma therapy DOES work: Doctors say the treatment saved life of a coronavirus patient near deathÂ
item.description: Doctors at UMass Memorial Medical Center in Worcester received their first shipment this weekend and gave it to a male patient who was near death, who improved within a few hours.

item.title: Beauty queen finalists don gowns to feed chickens and mow the lawn after grand final was cancelled
item.description: Determined to not let their glamorous frocks and stilettos go to waste, the would-be Miss Wales contestants have worn them to mow the lawn, wak the dogs and feed some chickens.

item.title: Met Police arrest 100 people a day for domestic violence in lockdown
item.description: Metropolitan Police Commander Sue Williams said charges and cautions were up 24 per cent from March 9, when people with Covid-19 symptoms were asked to self-isolate, compared to last year.

item.title: Is Boris Johnson already working part-time at Chequers? No10 fails to dampen speculation on return
item.description: HisÂ official spokesman said today that he was receiving 'updates on the coronavirus response' and spoke to Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab and Matt Hancock, the Health Secretary, yesterday.

item.title: Police chief slams national guidance on driving for exercise
item.description: Shaun Sawyer, chief constable for Devon and Cornwall police, said the guidance was 'poor' and would lead to people heading into his force area, which is not what communities want.

item.title: France LIMITS sale of nicotine substitutes to avoid stockpiling
item.description: The government said that until May 11, when the country's lockdown is phased out, pharmacies would only be able to sell a maximum of one month's worth of products treating nicotine dependence.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Trump's coronavirus 'cure' theories will kill
item.description: President Trump stooped to a shameful new low by suggesting people suffering from COVID-19 be injected with toxic disinfectant. It's hard to imagine a more stupid thing for a President to say

item.title: Sophie Wessex provides a glimpse of her stunning Bagshot ParkÂ kitchen
item.description: The Countess joined a video call with Thames Valley Air Ambulance, of which she is patron, from her Bagshot Park kitchen to congratulate them on their work with the NHS during the current crisis.

item.title: Coronavirus hopes dashed as trial finds promising HIV drug have little effect on patients
item.description: Patients given HIV drug lopinavir/ritonavir or flu tablets Arbidol did not improve any quicker than those treated without medication, according to the study of 86 patients in Guangzhou, China.

item.title: Former Cambridge University maths student, 23, appears in court charged with anti-Semitic hate crime
item.description: Oliver Bel, 23, from Manchester, appeared in court accused of making a 'grossly offensive' post about Jewish people in 2017 and having a copy of the Anarchist's Cookbook last year.

item.title: Germany starts preparing for SECOND wave of coronavirus
item.description: Germany's infection rate has slowed to a record low this week, with only a 1.6 per cent growth in cases for each of the last three days (new cases are shown on a graph, with 2,337 added today).

item.title: True scale of North Korea's coronavirus deaths 'very likely exceeds imagination', defector warns
item.description: North Korea is hiding the true devastation dealt to its people by coronavirus in a bid to spare China embarrassment, a senior defector has revealed. The true number 'very likely... exceeds imagination'.
item.media:credit: KCNA VIA KNS/AFP via Getty Image

item.title: British tourists have to prove they are covid-19 free and have movements tracked in Canary Islands
item.description: Foreign holidaymakers would be expected to download the movement tracking app on to thier devices before being allowed to step foot in the Canary Islands, claims tourism chiefs.

item.title: Retail sales suffer biggest monthly drop since records began after coronavirus closes stores
item.description: Stores including Debenhams, Animal andÂ Laura Ashley have all had to close stores as the bloodbath on the High Street continues.

item.title: Mourners in Birmingham queue at cemetery gates to visit loved ones after council eases restrictions
item.description: People were finally able to pay their respects at cemeteries across Birmingham after the council eased restrictions on graveyards. Mourners can now visit during a two-hour window.

item.title: Doorbell camera shows delivery driver spitting on customer's porch
item.description: Corinne Howart, from Birmingham, caught the disgusting moment on her doorbell camera earlier this month after reviewing the footage. Ms Howart, who suffers from asthma said he is angry.

item.title: Prince Charles praises the 'vital role' of theÂ British Asian community
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, has praised the British Asian community for it's contribution to the national coronavirus pandemic as he launched a fundraising appeal for families struggling in South Asia.

item.title: Jonny May uses a hyperbaric chamber as the England star attempts to recover from injuryÂ
item.description: Without the state-of-the-art medical equipment he is used to at Leicester Tigers and the England camp, Jonny May has installed a hyperbaric chamber at his home to help him bounce back from injury.

item.title: Matt Hancock loses his cool over coronavirus lockdown demands
item.description: Matt Hancock today lost his cool as he was grilled over the UK government's failure to set out its strategy for easing the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Matt Hancock sounds like a quartermaster, says ex-head of Army medics Dr Michael von Bertele
item.description: It is vital that the government reviews its strategy and focuses on the end state, not the current battle, writes DR MICHAEL VON BERTELE, former Director General of Army Medical Services.

item.title: Traveller funeral is broken up by police after mourners seize the body back from morgue
item.description: Up to 60 grievers, some swigging beer,Â were moved on by Bedfordshire Police during the service for a woman atÂ Dunstable Cemetery at around 10am yesterday.

item.title: Former top civil servant Gus O'Donnell urges ministers to use 'wellbeing' analysis to ease lockdown
item.description: Lord O'Donnell urged ministers to use quality of life measures balanced against the death toll to allow the UK to follow Sweden's example of a gradual lifting of restrictions.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle send sympathy message to family of girl, 18, who died during lockdown
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle sent a personal message of condolence to a Liverpool family whose terminally-ill daughter died. Holly Smallman, 18, met Harry when he gave her sister Ruby an award.

item.title: Masks made from cotton with natural silk or chiffon provide best protection against COVID-19
item.description: Scientists from the University of Chicago have claimed that homemade masks made from cotton combined with natural silk or chiffon provide the best protection against coronavirus.

item.title: Covid-19 lockdown sees personal hygiene standards slip
item.description: Anglo-Dutch manufacturer Unilever has seen a slump in demand for deodorant and shampoo as Britons working from home appear to be letting their grooming standards slip now they are away from the office.

item.title: China names first Mars exploration mission Tianwen-1 after an ancient poem
item.description: Tianwen-1 is a robotic exploration mission to the Red Planet and is due to launch in the summer of this year - around the same time as the NASAÂ Perseverance rover.

item.title: The stunning winning images in the All About Photo Awards 2020 photography competition
item.description: The All About Photo Awards - The Mind's Eye has announced 40 winning images for 2020. Monica Denevan from the U.S was named Photographer of the Year for an image shot in Myanmar.

item.title: Hilarious moment woman live-streams desperate hunt for her missing PARROT after it escaped
item.description: Sandra Hannah, 40, posted a video on Facebook of her parading the streets in Netherton, Liverpool and crying out 'Chanel' - the bird's name. Sandra insisted that it was 'traumatic'.

item.title: Stylish dog owner dresses her three-year-old whippet
item.description: Paz Castro, 38, a jewellery designer, from Hackney, London, aspired for her three-year-old whippet Lloyd to mirror her monochrome style of grey turtle necks and neutral fabrics.

item.title: Carers moved into TENTS in residential home's garden
item.description: Carers who moved intoÂ Victoria House care home on the Isle of Wight due to coronavirus said on This Morning they hope their actions will inspire others to appreciate care workers more,

item.title: Coronavirus: Bundesliga stars 'may have to play in MASKS... with games STOPPED if they slip off'
item.description: Leaked documents in Germany have revealed the plans to equip all the players with masks to be worn throughout the entirety of a match.

item.title: Princess Charlotte is 'a little leader',Â says body language expert
item.description: Body language expert Judi James has analysed footage of the Cambridges with their three children as they led the weekly Clap For Carers from their Norfok Home, Anmer Hall, last night.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: FTSE drops again as it slumps due to gloomy prospects for new drugs
item.description: The FTSE 100 index of Britain's largest companies dropped by 1.48 per today after US markets fell following a report that Gilead Sciences's antiviral drug Remdesivir failed to help severely ill patients.

item.title: Kate Garraway says husband Derek is still 'critically ill in intensive care'
item.description: Kate Garraway's husband Derek Draper is now in a coma in intensive care as he continues his battle against coronavirus

item.title: NASA engineers design a mass-producible ventilator tailored to coronavirus patients
item.description: The 'Ventilator Intervention Technology Accessible Locally' (VITAL) device passed a critical test at theÂ Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai in New York on April 21.

item.title: Russia denies hiding coronavirus figures as 5,849 new cases are recorded
item.description: Sergei Sobyanin said Russia's 0.9 per cent mortality rate was so low because of mass testing which leads to a high number of confirmed infections.

item.title: Builder sues church for 'religious discrimination' after he was kicked out of priest's home
item.description: Builder Jonathan Bennetts and his family moved into the St Just Free Church manse in Penzance, Cornwall on reduced rent for voluntary caretaking but was kicked out after a new minister was appointed.

item.title: Police seize Rolls-Royce and Bentley at luxury Cotswolds hotel in probe into London brothels
item.description: A businessman was arrested at his luxury Victorian-era Cotswolds hotel (pictured) as the Met Police investigates a crime group believed to be sexually exploiting women in brothels in Westminster.

item.title: Mother of missing boy, 16, whose girlfriend feared was walking miles to see her reveals heartache
item.description: Owen Harding is thought to have headed to a well-known cliffside path near his home in Saltdean, East Sussex. He was last seen on CCTV cameras heading to the coast on March 26.

item.title: British 'ISIS rapper' was caught in Spain after he was identified by his EARS as he hid behind maskÂ
item.description: British 'ISIS rapper' Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary was identified by his ears after sneaking into Spain by boat, it emerged today. Bary, 29, took advantage of coronavirus lockdown to hide behind a face mask.

item.title: Coronavirus: Guernsey on its way out of lockdown
item.description: Some businesses on the Channel Island - which is a self-governing British Crown dependency - have been told they may start fully or partially operating again.

item.title: YouTube's first video was uploaded 15 years ago and has been viewed 90 MILLION times
item.description: Today marks the 15th anniversary for the first video uploaded to YouTube. The clip, called 'Me at the zoo,' features the site's co-founder Jawed Karim talking about elephants.

item.title: Music industry opposes UK Music's appointment of Tom Watson as chairman
item.description: Tom Watson is a controversial figure for many reasons chief amoung them being his support for an investigation into an alleged Westminster VIP peadophile ring in 2012.

item.title: Chessington testing centre 'loses NHS staff results or sends them to wrong people'
item.description: The facility at the Surrey theme park, run by accountancy firm Deloitte, also was not able to contact workers with their diagnosis because they recorded incorrect phone numbers, it is claimed.

item.title: Outspoken mother-in-law brands bride-to-be's SEE THROUGH dress 'vile' in Say Yes To The Dress
item.description: Mel, from Lancashire, wants her wedding dress to be 'the sexiest' ever in tonight's episode of TLC's Say Yes To The Dress. However, her mother-in-law Denise wants her to opt for 'classy not trashy.'

item.title: Woman who has been indulging in a bottle of wine each night since lockdown begun
item.description: A woman who has been drinking a bottle of wine daily since the UK lockdown sparked a debate about alcohol consumption on Mumsnet, where some warned that she's overdoing it.

item.title: Japanese mayor says only men should be allowed to go grocery shopping
item.description: 'When a woman goes... it will take time,' Mayor of Osaka Matsui Ichiro said when asked about possibly reducing shoppers' entry to supermarkets to lower the risk of coronavirus spread.

item.title: China to prosecute first foreigner for 'funding enemies in the US' and 'meddling' in Hong Kong
item.description: Lee Henley Hu Xiang, a Belizean citizen, is facing charges of funding and endangering national security. He was transferred Thursday for prosecution in Chinese southern city Guangzhou.

item.title: Baby's bad hair day! Three-week-old mountain gorilla sports an untamed frizzy mop
item.description: The three-week-old frizzy haired Mountain Gorilla was spotted by British photographer Kirsty Taylor, after catching sight of the family while treking around the Volcanoes National Park, Rwanda.

item.title: How Marcus Rashford's childhood has driven Â£20m crusade to feed Manchester kids during Covid crisis
item.description: CHRIS WHEELER: The coronavirus crisis stirred something very close to home for Marcus Rashford. He thought of vulnerable children, much like himself at school, who may go hungry or suffer.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Janet Street-Porter says bureaucrats impede NHS
item.description: In the UK, everyone knows or knows of someone who has died from Covid-19 and our lives have dramatically changed for the foreseeable future, writes JANET STREET-PORTER.

item.title: The Big Night In viewers express concern over Peter Kay after he 'looks unwell'
item.description: The comedian, 46, appeared in a clip from his Bolton home to introduce his track Is This The Way to Amarillo.

item.title: Prince William Zoom call with Stephen Fry as Lord Melchett in Big Night In TV fundraiser
item.description: Lord Melchett paced around his office impatiently waiting for the Duke of Cambridge to call in, quipping: 'I thought Germans were meant to be punctual'.

item.title: Liverpool are set to be Premier League champions even if the season DOESN'T finish
item.description: LiverpoolÂ are set to finally end their 30-year wait to be champions of England after UEFA ruled out the Premier League season being declared 'null and void'.

item.title: Social distan-sing! Plans are unveiled for world's first drive-in opera at Alexandra Palace
item.description: Performers will adhere to social-distancing rules during the performance of Puccini's La BohÃ¨me and Mozart's The Magic Flute, which will take place over three weeks in September in Haringey, north London.

item.title: Mother, 30, was left 'in hysterics' from huge veneers
item.description: Sara Hamilton, 30, from Bolton, was unhappy with her smile after Type 1 diabetes caused her teeth to become damaged through sugar decay, and decided to buy veneers on Amazon.

item.title: Ricky Gervais takes aim at preaching celebs (and THAT Imagine video) in epic rantÂ
item.description: He famously speaks his mind and has condemned theÂ sycophancy of Hollywood.Â So Ricky didn't hold back in his latest rant as he lashed out at celebrities for using their platforms to preach.

item.title: 'Idiots' blasted for cramming onto London's Westminster Bridge to clap for NHS workers
item.description: Shocking photographs showed members of the public clearly defying guidelines to stay 6ft apart as they took part in the Clap for Carers salute to frontline staff.

item.title: Coronavirus: Prince William and Kate Middleton clap for carers
item.description: Prince William, Kate Middleton, and their children put their hands together to praise everyone from NHS healthcare workers to shop assistants.

item.title: The surprising signs of COVID-19 in elderly people
item.description: Changes to the immune system and reflexes may mean that elderly people with coronavirus do not develop cough and fever, but the virus may cause cognitive issues and extreme fatigue in them.

item.title: City centre on lockdown as armed police rush to tackle knifeman
item.description: Officers were sent to Chichester city centre at around 10pm on Thursday and engaged in a three hour stand-off with a knife-wielding man.

item.title: Expert shares advice for cleaning areas of the home that are often forgotten
item.description: Cleaning experts from British electrical retailer AO.com have revealed their top cleaning tips to FEMAIL, including disinfecting your shoe rack, because COVID-19 can survive on soles.

item.title: Coronavirus patients' EYES could be contagious for WEEKS, study suggests
item.description: A case study of a 65-year-old woman in Italy found that coronavirus was actively making copies of itself in her eyes before she had a fever - and persisted for weeks, even after fading elsewhere.

item.title: Bodies piled up in Brazilian city of Manaus because of coronavirus
item.description: The mayor of Manaus Virgilio Neto said his city was 'no longer in a state of emergency but rather of absolute calamity' after the daily death rate shot up from 20-30 per day to more than 100.

item.title: CDC TRIPLES list of coronavirus symptoms: Loss of taste & smell are official signs of infectionÂ
item.description: This weekend, the CDC expanded its list of possible coronavirus symptoms to include chills, repeated shaking with chills, muscle pain, headache, sore throat and new loss of taste or smell.

item.title: Luxury shoppers are buying rare handbags and trainers more than ever
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL, David Bennett, Worldwide Chairman of Sotheby's Jewellery Division, said luxury goods are having their best performance ever, because they're safer than gold or stock.

item.title: A FIFTH of New York City residents tested positive for coronavirus antibodies in Cuomo's studyÂ
item.description: The study took samples from 3,000 randomly selected people across the state. Statewide, the virus prevalence was 13.9 percent but it was far higher in New York City, with 21.2 percent.

item.title: Brainteaser challenges nation to find two stray ballet shoes hidden among the dancers
item.description: A tricky new brainteaser, created by Harlequin Floors, challenges the nation to find the two ballet shoes hidden among the dancers. The record stands at 15 seconds - but can you beat it?

item.title: Apple says there is 'no evidence' flaw in Mail app for iPhones and iPads used to attack customers
item.description: San Francisco-based security firm ZecOps revealed a flaw on April 22 that it said may have left more than half a billion iPhones vulnerable to hackers.

item.title: Mother-of-two, 38, spends THREE hours transforming into Boris Johnson
item.description: Mother-of-two Alana Pignatiello, 38, from Paisley, Scotland, spends three hours creating transformations while in lockdown. She said Boris Johnson was the most requested look.

item.title: Man quoted Â£900 to renovate kitchen does it himself for just Â£91
item.description: Calum Butler, 23, from Aberaeron, Wales, gave his 'dark and outdated' kitchen a modern makeover for just Â£91 - after being quoted Â£900 by a professional.

item.title: Home cook recreates KFC chicken drumsticks at home in a simple recipe
item.description: Ernestina Agyei, from London, shared the recipe for homemade KFC with her Instagram followers, revealing the 11 herbs and spices she used to recreated the chain's secret blend.

item.title: Gilead disputes data leak showing its drug failed to improve the conditions of COVID-19 patients
item.description: The World Health Organization prematurely posted a draft summary of a trial being conducted on coronavirus patients in China saying remdesivir was infective in treating COVID-19 patients.

item.title: Nando's release a step by step guide to their famous recipes
item.description: As many Brits are craving their favourite takeaways during the lockdown, restaurant chain Nando's have released a step by step guide to their famous dishes during a cook-along live on Instagram.

item.title: Harry Dunn death: RAF base probes crash as SECOND American accused of driving on wrong side
item.description: The Harry Dunn family have called for RAF Croughton to launch a probe after claiming images of a crash involving a staff member in Aynho, Northamptonshire, emerged last night.

item.title: Bill Gates compares COVID-19 to WWII as it defines a generation
item.description: The billionaire philanthropist posted a memo aboutÂ 'the first modern pandemic'. 'No one who lives through Pandemic 1 will ever forget it', Gates said Thursday

item.title: Peeling carrots wrong your whole life! Video showing the correct way takes the internet by storm
item.description: A British man has discovered a simple way to peel carrots in just seconds - and it turns out thousands of home cooks have all been doing it wrong their whole lives.

item.title: Top Iranian commander orders naval forces to target any 'terrorist' US warships
item.description: Iranian Revolutionary Guards commander Major General Hossein Salami made the announcement about the naval directive while speaking with state press.

item.title: Sleep expert reveals EXACTLY what happens to your body when you oversleep
item.description: A sleep expert revealed exactly what happens to your body when you over-sleep or sleep for longer than ten hours - and it's bad news for your concentration, mood, performance and waistline.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS:Â Forget fake news... fake cheese is the real problem to chew over
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: To listen to Donald Trump and his querimonious outbursts, you'd think 'fake news' never existed before he arrived in the White House.

item.title: Home cook reveals a simple trick that will stop food going to waste
item.description: Creative home cooks are making 'pizza omelettes' with the old vegetables in their fridge to prevent food wastage - with surprisingly tasty results.

item.title: BAZ BAMIGBOYE: Take That are to relight their fire... with big screen version of their stage musical
item.description: BAZ BAMIGBOYE: The big screen version of Take That musical The Band is being actively developed during the lockdown, with 'high calibre' film stars being sought to appear in it.

item.title: With no planes, clear skies, and spring in the air, there is no better time to become a twitcherÂ
item.description: No planes, clear skies, spring weather: There's no better time to become a bird watcher and now Mail cartoonist Paul Thomas's guide has produced a handy guide to get people started.

item.title: PATRICK MARMION: Brush up on the Birthday Bard... then you can impress thy friends on Zoom!Â
item.description: PATRICK MARMION: Forsooth, gentle reader, is this, or is this not the week of Shakespeare's birth? Let us undertake a little 'True Or False' quiz on England's national poet...

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Question - What is the point of Public Health England? Answer - passÂ
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: From the Off, I've been happy to admit that when it comes to the coronavirus crisis I don't have a clue. Is the lockdown justified? Should it be lifted immediately?

item.title: You don't need to win Â£58 million on the lottery to learn the value of money - try lockdown instead
item.description: TOM UTLEY: I couldn't help feeling a momentary twinge of sympathy for Ryan Hoyle, 38, when I read yesterday that the self-employed joiner had just won Â£58,366,487 in the EuroMillions draw.

item.title: The great chocdown quiz!
item.description: With our locals shut for the foreseeable future, families have been turning to video-call apps such as Zoom and FaceTime to keep up their passion for proving their trivia knowledge to each other.

item.title: TikTok users are sharing their glow-DOWNS, before-and-after pictures showing they 'peaked' long ago
item.description: Gabrielle McDonald wanted to see the opposite of glow-ups. She said: 'The hottest I've ever been was when I was 18. I look nothing like that now.'

item.title: Africa's 43% jump in virus cases in one week as WHO warn continent could become the next epicentre
item.description: African governments reported a total of nearly 26,000 cases as of today, according to the Africa Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. That figure is up from just over 16,000 a week ago.

item.title: Make them think it was their idea! Marketing expert explores the art of persuasion
item.description: Jonah Berger who is a marketing professor at the University of Pennsylvania, has advised Apple and Nike. In a new book, he shares advice for changing people's minds.

item.title: Millionaire Castaway David Glasheen reveals his top tips for living in isolation
item.description: David Glasheen, 76, has been living on Restoration Island off the coast of north Australia since 1997 after losing his wealth. He hunts for food and goes grocery shopping once a year in Cairns.

item.title: Why therapy is no match for the true madness of GRIEF
item.description: UK-based author Juliet Rosenfeld has penned a memoir detailing the loss of her partner and loss of faith in the power of psychoanalysis to make soothing sense of trauma.

item.title: Think you're tough? Try herding a Galloway cow
item.description: Patrick Laurie who is a farmer in Galloway, Scotland, has penned a new nature book. He has seen a decline of the curlew and claims Galloway cattle has become a rare breed.

item.title: Cambridgeshire motorist is spared jail after punching cyclist to death over a broken wing mirror
item.description: Nicolae Budurus, 40, was given a suspended prison sentence after admitting to the manslaughter of Audrius Lapinskas, 30, who he believed had ripped the wing mirror off of his Mercedes.

item.title: 'A divisive waste of money':Â Standard Life Aberdeen pulls out of Davos
item.description: Standard Life Aberdeen Chief exec Keith Skeoch has come to the view that attending next January would be insensitive to the grim realities of life in the pandemic for millions of ordinary people.

item.title: Asteroid set to fly by Earth next week appears to 'wearing a face mask'
item.description: An asteroid half the size of Mount Everest will fly by Earth next week and experts have captured a photo of the object as it moves towards our planet.- and it seems to be 'wearing a face mask.'

item.title: Wodaabe tribe where MEN spend hours doing their hair and makeup to impress women
item.description: The Wodaabe tribe are often known as the vaniest in Africa because of how their culture prizes beauty - but it is the men who are expected to make the effort, especially during the annual Gerewol festival.

item.title: Singer wows with an impromptu performance in hospital car park
item.description: Michael MacDonald, 30, spent three hours outside Churchill Hospital in Oxford as coronavirus restrictions mean he was unable to go inside to comfort his friend, Steve Vincent, 26.

item.title: Lockdown punch-up! Stunt school students trade blows in an ingenious coronavirus challenge video
item.description: Students from the stunt double school Campus Univers Cascades in northern France made a clever video of students punching or kicking each other in an elaborate chain of staged violence.

item.title: Public can vote for their favourite New Big Five animals to photograph
item.description: The project has been launched by UK-based photographer Graeme Green. It is supported by other renowned wildlife photographers, who have revealed some of their favourite shots.
